name: Flower Jellyfish

ability.name: Ride the Wave
ability.text: Once during your opponent's turn, if your opponent uses an effect of an Ability, you may have both players draw 1 card. Only 1 Ride the Wave Ability may be used each turn.

attacks.name: Pulse Wave
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokemon. Each player switches their Active pokemon with one of their Benched Pokemon.

flavour: These sea jellies are endemic to the Western Pacific, commonly found off the Southern Japan coast and also within the water of Brazil and Argentina.

name: Crystal Jellyfish

ability.name: Stinging Cells
ability.text: Once during your turn, before you attack, you may use this Ability. Discard 1 card from your hand and 1 Pokemon from your Bench. If you do, your opponent's Active Pokemon is now Paralyzed

attacks.name: Digest
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokemon is Knocked Out by damage from this attack, search your deck for any 2 cards and put it into your Draw Zone.

flavour: located in the water around North America's coast, this jellyfish species is actually completely colorless, hence its name! This beautiful specimen has around 150 tentacles lining its glass-like bell and in the daylight it looks crystal clear. Although, this transparency belies a brighter side.

name: Narcomedusae

ability.name: Stinging Tentacles
ability.text: You may use this Ability when this Pokemon takes damage from your opponent's attack. Put 2 damage counters on the Defending Pokemon

attacks.name: Call for Help
attacks.text: Draw 1 card from the top of your deck, or search your deck for a Basic Pokemon and put it onto your Bench, then shuffle your deck.

flavour: Known to have a Darth Vader kind of appearance.

name: Blood Jellyfish

attacks.name: Cilia Activation
attacks.text: Look at and rearrange your opponent's top 3 cards of their deck. Then, you may attach an Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokemon.

attacks.name: Deadly Sting
attacks.text: If your opponent has 7 or more cards in their hand, the Defending Pokemon is now Knocked Out.

flavour: Known to have a Darth Vader kind of appearance.

name: Nightmare Beluga

attacks.name: Ocean Scream
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to each Pokemon in play that already has damage counters on it (both yours and your opponent's) (excluding any Nightmare Beluga in play).

attacks.name: Freezing Death
attacks.text: Look at your opponent's hand and choose 1 card. Your opponent discards that card.

flavour: This whale is the creatue that forms the pinnacle of seamens nightly voyages through dreamland.

name: Friendly Beluga

ability.name: Ocean Bounty
ability.text: Once during your turn (before you attack), if you have any cards in your hand and at least 1 damage counter on any of your Pokemon, you may use this Power. Both players discard 1 card from their hand (if any cards in hand). Then, both players remove 3 damage counter from 1 of their Pokemon. Only 1 Ocean Bounty Pokemon Power may be used each turn.

flavour: The Friendly Beluga whale has been spotted wearing human-made equipment.

name: Small Barracuda

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokemon and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterwards.

flavour: The barracuda can move up to a speed of 40 km/t.

name: Great Barracuda

ability.name: Rapid Burst
ability.text: Once during your turn (before you attack), if this card is in your hand, you may put this card onto a Small Barracuda (this counts as evolving). If you do, put 3 damage counters on this Pokemon.

flavour: Barracuda are snake-like in appearance, with prominent, sharp-edged, fang-like teeth, much like piranha, all of different sizes, set in sockets of their large jaws.

name: Norwegian Seagull

ability.name: Hovering Screech
ability.text: When you play this card from your hand onto your Bench, you may use this Power. Put 1 damage counter on 1 of your opponent's Pokemon.

attacks.name: Eat Trash
attacks.text: Put 1 card from your hand on top of your deck. Return this card and all cards attached to it to your hand.

flavour: This bird is said to be among the top 5 most annoying creatures on the entire planet.

name: Pet Turtle

attacks.name: Withdraw
attacks.text: Until the end of your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokemon. This Pokemon can not use Withdraw during your next turn.

flavour: The pet turtle is cute, but in an odd way.

ability.name: Healing Skin
ability.text: At the beginning of your turn, if this card is in your Active Spot, you may use this Power. Remove 2 damage counters from this Pokemon.

attacks.name: Inclusive Shell
attacks.text: Put 1 of your Pokmeon and all cards attached to it into your hand. Then, put 3 damage counters on this Pokemon.

name: Snapping Turtle

ability.name: Exoskeleton
ability.text: You may use this Power when your opponent uses and attack. Add -20 to all damage done to this Pokemon.

attacks.name: Fierce Bite
attacks.text: For each damage counter on this Pokemon, subtract 10 damage from this attack. After doing damage, put 3 damage counters on this Pokemon.

flavour: This nasty, chonky creatue is often mistaken of not being harmful. When approached by gullible, humanoid individuals, the Snapping Turtle strikes with lightning fast speed.

name: Tiny Marlin

attacks.name: Double Edged Snout
attacks.text: Flip a coin, if heads, draw 3 cards. If tails, your opponent draws up to 2 cards.

flavour: All right, I know one joke. Um, there's a mollusk, see? And he walks up to a sea... Well, he doesn't walk up, he swims up.

name: Atlantic Marlin

ability.name: Disappointing Quality
ability.text: When this Pokemon is Knocked Out, you may use this Power. Choose 1 of your opponent's face down or face up Prize Cards, and reveal it. Your opponent can not take that Prize for knocking out this Pokemon (except if the Prize Card you chose is your opponent's last Prize Card).

attacks.name: Stab
attacks.text: Flip a coin, if heads, your opponent shuffles 1 card from their hand into their deck.

flavour: There is only 1 kind of Atlantic Marlin. Yet there are 3 in this expansion.

name: Great Atlantic

attacks.name: School Hunt
attacks.text: If your opponent has 5 or more Benched Pokemon, discard 1 of them. You choose which to discard.

attacks.name: Impaling Spear
attacks.text: You may reveal your hand to your opponent. If you do, this attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokemon.

flavour: There was this mollusk and he walks up to a sea cucumber. Normally the don't talk, sea cucumbers, but in a joke, everyone talks. So just then, the sea cucumber looks over to the mollusk and says: 'With friend like these, who need anemones?'

name: Professor Vestre
text:
Reduce the cost of each of your Pokemon's attacks by C until the end of your turn.
Draw 3 cards.

name: Spring Tide
text: Once during your turn, you may attach 2 Basic Energy from your Discard Pile to your Pokemon as you like. Then, your turn ends.

name: Ocean Current
text: Search your Discard Pile for a Pokemon or a Basic Energy card and put it into your hand.

name: Tord's Bathing Shoes
text: This Pokemon's HP is increased by 20.

name: Flout Energy
text: This card provies C. While the Pokemon this card is attached to has any Basic Energy cards attached to it, and the Pokemon is not C, this card provides 2 Energy of any type, but not the same type of other Basic Energy cards attached to the Pokemon.
